page.title: 01Weybourne, Marsh & Heath
page.content: The Area comprises coastal marshes behind a shingle bank changing to heath on higher ground to the south. The main residential area lies between Heath and Marsh. Occupations are arable farming and tourism. Many houses are for holiday letting. At Weybourne ther is an hotel and restaurant, a public house, and a highly esteemed restaurant which caters for both tourists and residents from a wide area. Weybourne has a church adjoining the ruins of an ancient priory. There is also a post office/general store and a garage with a mini market. At the eastern end of the village stands old tower windmill whuch has been restored and converted to a dwelling. Kelling is a small hamlet without shop, post-office or public house. It is totally residential with many holiday cottages
